newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-DISPUTED PENALTY GIVES REAL VALUABLE WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DISPUTED PENALTY GIVES REAL VALUABLE WIN.

text.p: Real Madrid took a giant step towards securing the Spanish league championship on Sunday by beating Valladolid 1-0 on a disputed penalty by Davor Suker.

With four games left, Real moved eight points clear of arch-rivals Barcelona, who face Celta Vigo on Monday. But Barcelona saw their own chances of ensuring Spain's second European Cup place boosted when rivals Deportivo Coruna and Real Betis were each held to home draws.

Real Madrid survived a disallowed goal and absorbed heavy pressure before the referee surprisingly awarded a penalty when striker Predrag Mijatovic collided with Juan Pena, who was sent off for another challenge shortly afterwards.

Third-placed Deportivo Coruna missed nearly a dozen clear chances and a late penalty in a goalless game with struggling Sporting Gijon, while Real Betis let neighbours Sevilla score twice in the final five minutes of their 3-3 draw on Saturday.
The results leave Deportivo four points behind Barcelona, with Betis a further point back in fourth.
